cyclone.name: COLIN
cyclone.current_location: about 125 mi NW of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northeast, forecast to cross Florida’s Big Bend on Monday, then accelerate northeastward parallel to the U.S. East Coast and pass well southeast of New England before heading toward the north-central Atlantic

weather_observation.warning_coast: Indian Pass to Englewood, Florida (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Big Bend, then along/just off the Southeast and Mid-Atlantic coasts before moving into the open Atlantic southeast of New England
weather_observation.wind: Low (≈3%) chance of tropical-storm-force gusts; most likely outcome is breezy northeast winds 20–30 mph Wednesday night–Thursday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along Boston Harbor; surge confined to Florida Gulf Coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of light to moderate rain possible late Wednesday into Thursday as the system’s outer bands pass well offshore
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated seas and rip-current risk for shipping lanes east of Cape Cod
